intro: Uragoga hieronymi, commonly known as the African violet, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements. Uragoga hieronymi is also known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions, making it a versatile choice for indoor gardening.
